revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{More citations needed|date=November 2008}} {{Taxobox | image = Psilocybe.villarrealiae.1.jpg | image_width = 250px | regnum = [[Fungi]] | divisio = [[Basidiomycota]] | classis = [[Agaricomycetes]] | ordo = [[Agaricales]] | familia = [[Strophariaceae]] | genus = [[Psilocybe]] | species = '''''P. villarrealiae''''' | binomial = ''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' | binomial_authority = Guzman (1998) }} {{mycomorphbox | name = Psilocybe villarrealiae | whichGills = adnate | whichGills2 = sinuate | capShape = conical | capShape2=convex | hymeniumType=gills | stipeCharacter=bare | ecologicalType=saprotrophic | sporePrintColor=purple-brown | howEdible=psychoactive}} '''''Psilocybe villarrealiae''''' is a [[psilocybin mushroom]] which has [[psilocybin]] and [[psilocin]] as its main active compounds. == Description == ''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' has a [[farinaceous]] taste and smell.
The [[Pileus (mycology)|cap]] is 2–12 cm in diameter, at first [[wikt:subconical|subconical]] to [[wikt:campanulate|campanulate]], expanding to convex or plane in age, often with a wavy margin. The cap color starts out tan to walnut brown and fades to yellow-brown as it ages, finally turning black. The cap surface is [[hygrophanous]], fading to tan as it dries. The cap is sometimes translucent-striate near the margin, often with an [[umbo (mycology)|umbo]]. It usually stains blue or black in age.
The [[Lamella (mycology)|gills]] are cream-colored when young, violet brown in age, with a [[wikt:subsinuate|subsinuate]] or [[wikt:adnate|adnate]] attachment.
''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' spores are dark violet brown, oblong to ellipsoid or [[wikt:subrhomboid|subrhomboid]], thin-walled, and 7 x 4 [[µm]].
The [[stipe (mycology)|stipe]] is central, equal, flexuous, and cylindric; it is 3–12 cm long and 3–7 mm thick. It is reddish brown fading to grey-yellow and finally dark, ornamented with a [[wikt:floccose|floccose]] [[mycelium]], especially with the bottom half. The upper part of the stipe bruises blue-green. The [[partial veil]] is white and [[wikt:arachnoid|arachnoid]], disappearing in age. ==Distribution and habitat== ''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' grows solitarily or [[wikt:gregarious|gregariously]] in groups, often forming [[wikt:cespitose|cespitose]] clusters. It is found growing directly from the ground in muddy soil in pine and oak woods and subtropical forests, usually near small creeks and ravines and is known only from [[Jalisco, Mexico]]. Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.2.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.3.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.4.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.5.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.6.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.7.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.8.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' Image:Psilocybe.villarrealiae.9.jpg|''Psilocybe villarrealiae'' ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite journal |author=Guzmán G. |title=Las Especies de Psilocybe (Fungi, Basidiomycotina, Agaricales) Conocidas de Jalisco (Mexico) Y Descripcion de dos Nuevas Para la Cienca |journal=Acta Botanica Mexicana |year=1998 |volume=43 |pages=23–32 |language=Spanish}} }} == External links == * [https://mushroomobserver.org/4426 Mushroom Observer - ''Psilocybe villarrealiae''] * [https://mushroomobserver.org/4443 Mushroom Observer - ''Psilocybe villarrealiae''] {{Hallucinogenic mushrooms}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q7255951}} [[Category:Entheogens]] [[Category:Psychoactive fungi]] [[Category:Psilocybe|villarrealiae]] [[Category:Psychedelic tryptamine carriers]]
